docs.lead_paragraph: Going to the Caribbean solo to compare the swinging singles style of Club Med with the more refined Gansevoort.
docs.abstract: Stephanie Rosenbloom travel article on heading to Club Med Turkoise in search of the elusive vacation for the solo traveler; Gansevoort hotel at the resort offers a refined contrast to the Club Med's warmth and playfulness.
docs.snippet: Going to the Caribbean solo to compare the swinging singles style of Club Med with the more refined Gansevoort.

docs.lead_paragraph: The military has removed dietary supplements containing the ingredient dimethylamylamine from stores on its bases, though the products are widely available elsewhere in the country.

headline.seo: Army Studies Workout Supplements After 2 Deaths
headline.main: Army Studies Workout Supplements After Deaths
headline.print_headline: Army Studies Workout Supplements After Deaths

docs.abstract: United States Army is investigating whether certain dietary supplements for athletes, which it has pulled from stores on its bases, may have played a role in the 2011 deaths of two soldiers; products are widely available elsewhere in the country.
docs.snippet: The military has removed dietary supplements containing the ingredient dimethylamylamine from stores on its bases, though the products are widely available elsewhere in the country.

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject

byline.original: By PETER LATTMAN and NATASHA SINGER

docs.lead_paragraph: A new law that allows businesses in Philadelphia’s Market East district to draw revenue from large digital signs has drawn attention from developers.

headline.seo: In Philadelphia’s Market East, Sign Law Spurs Investment
headline.main: A Sign Law Spurs Investment in Philadelphia
headline.print_headline: A Sign Law Spurs Investment in Philadelphia

docs.abstract: Sign ordinance passed in Philadelphia to help create a digital district in the Market East section allows developers, in exchange for a minimum investment of $10 million, to erect and collect revenue from large digital signs and billboards on the outside of area buildings; Philadelphia Media Network, which publishes The Philadelphia Inquirer and The Daily News, is the first business to take advantage of the new law, signing a lease for 125,000 square feet of space on Market Street.
docs.snippet: A new law that allows businesses in Philadelphia’s Market East district to draw revenue from large digital signs has drawn attention from developers.
